data.title: Great place to have a Beer!
data.text:
Customer Service: Bartender has great knowledge about the beers. 
Beers: Amazing!
Enviroment: It is a pretty small Bar. I have visited it twice at noon and it was fine.
Food: they outsource, really smart strategy.

data.title: Not the best beer place in town
data.text: Overpriced and trendy. Although there are 60 taps, the selection is amateurish, limited, and confining ... too many sours and high ABV beers. Hard to find small production craft beers are not present.

data.title: Great for beer
data.text:
This is a great place to go if you like beer. They have around fifty beers and ciders available. All are listed on digital tablets on the bar. The staff are friendly and happy for you taste any beer before buying.
They don't do food as such but they do have menus for a couple of restaurants around. I chose a salad with fish and was very disappointed with what arrived.
I believe you can by your own take out and bring it with you. I would recommend this! 
As I believe a previous reviewer mentioned don't forget to use the cold panel at the back of the bar for keeping your beer cool in between sips!

data.title: So LOUD
data.text: This place is fun, but it is SO LOUD all the time.  It is hard to enjoy the company of whoever you are with.

data.title: Never eat here!
data.text: Wear here once and the food was bad.  Went a second time to give it another chance and there was no improvement plus while attempting to eat a couple of roaches "strolled" across our table.  Never going again!

data.title: Much Beer - Poor Vibe
data.text: Just not my kind of place. The opposite of a comfortable pub but probably nice if you want slick surfaces scrolling menu boards and an frozen trough on the bar to keep beer cold rather than elbow aged wood.

data.title: Could be great, with one small change
data.text: UOB is our go-to place for a Davis beer patio. The beertenders are knowledgeable, the tap selection is very very good, and they seem to do a good job at keeping the beer fresh and the lines clean. The bar doesn't serve food, but they will order from sister restaurants Ket-Mo-Ree and Red 88, deliver, and provide plates and cutlery. My big complaint is that the menus don't list pour sizes and prices. That makes me as frosty as the chill strip on the bartop. I've been told the new menu software will fix this - if so, my rating will shift to five points.

data.title: Beer Patio Davis
data.text: Great place to grab a flight of different beers and relax on the front patio and watch people go by.  They have a great selection of all types of beers to try or just drink a pint.  Light to dark to cider IPA Reds etc....Give it a try.

data.title: Nirvana for Beer Lovers
data.text: University of Beer is everything beer lovers should like and nothing we don't need.  60 rotating taps, mostly with craft brews, dominate the inside.  Menus are on iPads and the friendly staff is always willing to let you sample something if you're not sure before you buy.  Don't miss the frozen metal strip which runs all the way along the bar.  It stays cold and you rest your beer glass on it to keep your beer cold.  (Sounds obvious but most of the group I was with missed it.)  This is a 9 out of 10 and the only thing it is missing is something to snack on.

data.title: Who needs food when you have such great beer?
data.text: Featuring a wide array of beers and ciders, many of them hard to find in the area, it's one of my favorite places to just hang out in Davis.  There is seating inside but when the weather is pleasant sitting on the patio is the best.  It can get a little loud in the bar area.  There's always sports on the TVs.  The bartenders are friendly and well versed on their selections.  And....you can order food from local restaurants or bring food in.  Two thumbs up.

data.title: Great place to have a beer in Davis!
data.text: I live in Davis and my husband and I were walking around town and dropped into the University of Beer a few days ago.  I was so suprised to see their list of beers on tap. There were so many interesting beers to choose from!  The bartenders will give you tastes to help you choose what you want.  Great place to try new beers!  Can't wait to go back.

data.title: Good beers
data.text: They have good beers on draft and loved the screen touch menu. Cool atmosphere! We were visiting davis for a business trip but this place made us feel in college again!

data.title: Wide Selection
data.text: A friend and I decided to give the University of Beer a visit after a night of working over in Sacramento.  The place itself is pretty small and intimate, but the service is very good and the selections of beers on tap is immense.  They allow you to sample a number of the beers before you can make your choice, and I thought that was a nice thing.  We managed to choose a seasonal beer and it was great tasting!  Their prices are reasonable, and in my opinion it's a nice, casual place to hang out with some friends.

data.title: Beer, Glorious Beer!
data.text: Tons of GREAT beers on tap, even more available in the bottle. Bartenders extremely personable and knowledgable. They even stock some great sour beers, which is rare. 10 thumbs up.

data.title: Just tons of beer
data.text: A bar made for beer. 60 beers on taps and taste before buy. The best one? the Old Rasputin. A must in Davis!

data.title: Beer, beer, and thai food!
data.text:
60 beers on tap and a great description on the tablets of each one. Plus thai food delivered from across the street. We spent a good few hours here sampling and just having a great time. 

Oh! And they have a puppy hour on saturdays at the patio!

data.title: Awesome selection
data.text: We love these place when we are looking to try new beers.  The selection is unbeatable and it's nice to sit on the patio.

data.title: Nice selection of beers!
data.text: I love this place, nice atmosphere, the guys working there are super-friendly, and they have the best selection of beers in town. My only problem, the selection of beers is oriented towards very hoppy and strong-taste beers, with limited selection in the larger-pilsner-light beer segment. This is a pity, as among 60 beers on tap I would expect to have a little bit of everything for all tastes!

data.title: 60 beers on tap
data.text: They have ipads on the bar listing all the tap beers they have. Huge selection, friendly staff, good prices. Recommended.

data.title: Beer and more beer
data.text: Loved the selection and atmosphere.  Great get together spot.  You can order food from surrounding restaurants or just enjoy the drinks.

user_location.name: Las Cruces, New Mexico, United States
